comment.text:
Location: The Southern Gentleman is located on the second level of Buckhead Village. Such an amazing place for a weekend errand or shopping excursion. It's surrounded by some great Atlanta restaurants and shops. I parked in the parking deck across from Fetch and you get your ticket validated. I just moved to the area and can't wait to explore what more it has to offer!
Food/Price: This establishments is your typical mid to high level restaurant. I came for brunch so I would assume diner would be at least $30 per person. The She's a Peach is good and strong around $15. We had the chocolate chip banana bread and the white cheddar hush puppies with the goat cheese crèma. AMAZING! a must try if you go. For entrees, we had the fried chicken and skillet cake, short rib hash, and peach cobbler French toast. Everything was delicious!
Service: Our waitress McKayla was great and attentive! Our orders came out one after the other. Luckily we did have a reservation. 
Atmosphere: This restaurant is decorated beautifully for Christmas and feels like the inside of a grand hotel lobby. Picturesque!

Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed the Southern Gentleman. I can't wait to return and inquire if they allow big parties for birthday dinners!

photos.caption: Southern Fried Chicken & Country Skillet Cake

owner_replies.comment: Maniah, thank you for sharing your experience at The Southern Gentleman. We're delighted to hear that you enjoyed our food, Christmas decor, and McKayla's service. We do accommodate big parties for special occasions like birthday dinners, so please feel free to inquire on your next visit. We look forward to welcoming you back soon for another enjoyable dining experience.

comment.text: Had such a great experience here! Food was delicious! I highly recommend the fried green tomatoes, southern fried chicken & skillet cake (chicken & cornbread), braised short ribs, & any cocktail with Woodford Reserve. Service was excellent! Nice low music made for a great ambiance. Overall wonderful place to visit & can't wait to return here soon!

owner_replies.comment: Shana, thank you for your return visit. It's great to hear you had such a nice time, and we truly appreciate your very kind words. We look forward to serving you again soon!

comment.text:
Ohh, everything here was so good! Excellent service, tasty drinks and ridiculously good food. We enjoyed ourselves thoroughly.

I had the She's A Peach cocktail and it's a hit, with gin, lemon and rosé. 

All the servers were friendly and helpful, even if they weren't our server. One lady turned 21 and several patrons were giving her bday tips!

The Mac and cheese was on point, and I loved the hush puppies. I really enjoyed everything.

I'm definitely going back!

photos.caption: Birthday girl server who just turned 21 and everyone was tipping her. She wasn't our server. LOL

owner_replies.comment: Thank you, Wanda. It's nice to see you enjoyed your visit, and we greatly appreciate your wonderful review. Hopefully, you'll be back soon!

comment.text: Overpriced for average tasting food. The French toast was tough to bite on. Service was fast and good.

Southern Gentleman is the perfect weekend brunch spot! This restaurant is located right in Buckhead village and has a good amount of indoor and outdoor patio seating. Make sure to bring the ticket from the parking lot inside because they validate parking. 
I was able to make a reservation on Open Table the day prior so the process was super easy. I ordered an aperol spritz which was perfectly made! For our appetizers we ordered deviled eggs and white cheddar hushpuppies. My favorite hands down were the hushpuppies, the goat cheese cream was so fluffy and delicious! It paired really well. For my entree I ordered the fried chicken and country skillet cake. I was craving a salty - sweet brunch meal and this hit the spot! It's a different spin on the traditional chicken and waffles so I'm glad I tried it. The serving is super big so I had plenty to take home.

photos.caption: Southern Fried Chicken & Country Skillet Cake

owner_replies.comment: Hi Anika, thank you for taking the time to provide us with a review of your visit. We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your brunch so much, and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

comment.text: Great food,service & ambience. I would definitely return. The drinks were also delicious.

Finally got to try TSG for brunch! Service was a bit rushed since we could only get a resy 30 mins before closing, so we had to put our orders in asap before kitchen closed. 

I started out with the She's a Peach cocktail which tasted like a very delicious Bellini. For apps we got the white cheddar hush puppies which were very decadent but very good. For the entree I got the shrimp and grits which was truly a 10/10 for me. The shrimp were tender and the sauce was so flavorful, would definitely come back for this again! We also got to try an espresso martini which was lacking a bit for me. 

Loved the interior and the patio, and while the service was rushed, our server was very nice and efficient. Would come back!

owner_replies.comment: Hi Lidia. We're happy you joined us and enjoyed your shrimp, hushpuppies, and cocktails so much. We hope you'll be back again someday. Thank you!

comment.text: This place is definitely a must do. Great food options great for breakfast or dinner. Try it you will not be dissappppointed.

Came here for a friends birthday a few weeks ago!

***LOCATION***
There is a parking garage right next to the restaurant and THEY VALIDATE PARKING by scanning your ticket at the front (up to 2 hours I believe). 

***ATMOSPHERE***
The inside is very nice! It's like a chic southern food vibe. Wasn't too loud and the decor is nice! 

***STAFF***
I wish I could remember our waitresses name, but she was super friendly! We took forever to decide and even had someone showing up late but she was so patient with us!

***FOOD/DRINKS***
They have lots of options! Not too many vegetarian options, but they had some. They had 1 or 2 entrees, but I wasn't really interested in those that night. I opted for the Mac and cheese appetizer as my meal and it was very filling! It was very good and I also got a side of sweet potato cornbread which was definitely unique and tasted very good as well!
I got a sour beer to drink and it was normal, and reasonably priced! 

***PRICE***
They definitely are more upscale but they have options for everyone. I think my Mac and cheese was 15$ + 6$ I think for the cornbread. The draft beer was around 7$ I believe. They had entrees ranging from 18$ to like 60$. That's nice that they have such a range so that everyone in the party can order what they are comfortable with. The fried chicken was a favorite in our group and I believe it was around 21$. 

The only thing is that they won't split checks more than 2 ways unless everyone pays the same amount so it's divided equally. We were a group of 10 I think, so she divided the whole check and split it all evenly. Just something to note if you are going with a big party, either be prepared to split everything equally or Venmo each other! She did let us all know ahead of time though which was nice!

***CONCLUSION***
Would definitely come back!

owner_replies.comment: Kristen, thank you for your kind and thorough review. We're so pleased to know you and your group enjoyed your visit and that you will be joining us again someday. We look forward to serving you again soon!

comment.text:
Well, I was back literally a week later with another group of friends and today it was Michaela for the win!  She was super efficient, so friendly, could recommend menu items and was hustling to make everyone happy at all her tables!! 
Food was again fantastic.  We shared the deviled eggs, hush puppies and smoked bacon. Food disappeared so fast Its a wonder I was able to take pictures of most of it. We had entrees from the braised short rib hash, the croissant sandwich, French toast and soft scrambled eggs. All were delicious!  We got the apple cobbler and chocolate cake desserts to go. No pictures but both were also great.  

Get this spot on your list soon!

photos.caption: Beef Braised Short Rib with hash and eggs
Beef Braised Short Rib, with potatoes, fried eggs and hollandaise

owner_replies.comment: Simone, we're so pleased you made it back in and had such an enjoyable birthday brunch. Thank you for your compliments, and we look forward to seeing you more often in the future!

comment.text:
Don't believe the hype. Bougie southern food that's not worth the price. 

I think that the fried green tomatoes were the best thing.

owner_replies.comment:
Dia, thank you for your visit. I would love a second opportunity to impress you. Next time you can join us, please ask for a manager or me so we can help you find items you will love and make sure you have an outstanding experience. I hope to see you back in soon.
Chris Lamoree, General Manager

comment.text:
Really a bit closer to 3.5. Nice busy typical buckhead restaurant. Food is good. Location is premium. Service is awesome!!

Sweet potato bread - 4/5, deviled eggs 3/5, fried green tomatoes - 4/5, southern fried chicken 3/5, pot roast 4/5, cheeseburger 3/5, sweet potato corn bread- 5/5

Food - 3.5/5
Service - 4/5
Ambience - 3.5/5

owner_replies.comment: Paul, thank you for your compliments on our location and service and for your balanced feedback. Hopefully, we'll have the chance to serve you again someday to help you find more items you will love. We hope to see you soon.

comment.text:
Decided to dine last weekend at the Southern Gentleman for brunch with a friend. We had a great experience and service was 10/10!

Started off with the deviled eggs and hush puppies. The hush puppies were so delicious it made me wanna slap someone (truly)

And of course, we couldn't decide on a single meal so we ordered a few other things to share! 

Smoked Gouda Mac & Cheese, Chocolate Chip Banana Bread, braised short rib, and Stuffed "Apple Cobbler" French Toast - honestly most all of it was 10/10 but I would hone in on the hush puppies and the French toast.

The cocktails we ordered were great as well! Had three of them

owner_replies.comment: Hi Haley. We're happy you joined us and enjoyed your visit so much. We hope you'll be back again someday. Thank you!

comment.text:
Came to the Southern Gentleman with my college besties for happy hour. I've heard great things about this place, so it was nice to finally give them a try. We arrived around 5:15/5:30ish on a Friday. Perfect time as it was easy to get a table, and we still had about 30 mins left for happy hour. 

I ordered a drink called the Watermelon Basil Spritze ($9), Fried Green Tomatoes ($10), and the Sweet Potato Cornbread ($6- this is a side from their dinner menu). The drink was nice and refreshing. Perfect for a spring day. I absolutely looooved the fried green tomatoes! They were perfectly seasoned and sat on a spread of homemade pimento cheese with chunky pieces of fried bacon. This is a must have! The sweet potato cornbread was very good as well. It tasted like a cake, just not as sweet. My friends ordered a few sides and some other drinks as the night went on. Overall, I was impressed! I really look forward to coming back and trying more items on their menu!

photos.caption: Fried Green Tomatoes ($10 on happy hour menu. Delish!)
Sweet Potato Cornbread ($6 side on dinner menu)

owner_replies.comment: Hi Shantal. We're happy you joined us for happy hour and enjoyed your visit and especially our fried green tomatoes so much. We look forward to serving you again soon so you can try more of our menu.   Thank you!

comment.text:
The restaurant is located on the second floor of it building. It gives, open rooftop restaurant but we sat inside near the big open windows (which was a absolutely stunning view)  which is still an amazing choice seeming it was really cold out this day. The decor was definitely very clean, upscale, & cozy  (something you don't really see with southern food restaurants)

The food could've been better seasoned for southern/ soul food but my favorites we're definitely the deviled eggs and shrimp (appetizers); also the spicy cocktail


TBH: this was our only option after not making reservations on Valentine's Day weekend

photos.caption: Southern Fried Chicken & Country Skillet Cake
Southern Fried Chicken & Country Skillet Cake with Collard Greens*

owner_replies.comment: Hi Lexi. We're happy you joined us and enjoyed your visit. We hope you'll be back again someday, and we can help you find more items you will love. Thank you!

comment.text: Everything was perfect for a date with my lady. Our server was exceptional and was extremely helpful in assisting us on menu items as it was my first time at the restaurant. All aspects of the night left a lasting impression on us. The only thing that could've have made the restaurant more enjoyable was if it could been a quieter dining experience. However, I will not hold that against the restaurant (It was Valentine's Day).

owner_replies.comment: Jimmy, we're delighted to know you and your significant other had a perfect date night with us! We're thrilled that you enjoyed the service and menu suggestions, and we appreciate your feedback about the noise level. We'll see what we can do about that, and we look forward to welcoming you both back soon for another enjoyable evening!

comment.text: We dropped in for a quick drink.  Overall decent service with many options.  The atmosphere was low-key and comfortable.   We only had a quick snack so I can't comment on the overall food.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Bill, thank you for your visit and review! We're glad you enjoyed our service and atmosphere, but we hope you'll have the chance to try our food next time as well. Please let us know how it goes!

comment.text:
This time around, I visited The Southern Gentleman for a birthday. This was my second time ever visiting this restaurant. 

The Parking: There is a parking deck that you must park in, in order to visit this restaurant. Parking is $5 for up to 3 hours; however, this restaurant validated parking for up to 2 hours. Be sure to bring your parking slip.

The Service: The service was good. Our waitress was really nice!

The Atmosphere: It's like between mid-scale and upscale vibes. Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Nice luxurious bar with many TV screens.

The Food: This time around, I had the Classic Double Patty Cheeseburger (lettuce, red onion, bistro sauce. bread 8 butter pickles) & fries - $19. It was pretty good! I also ordered "She's a Peach" (gin, peach, lemon, rosé) - $13 and a Miller High Life - $4.

Overall, it was a decent time.

owner_replies.comment: Brent, thank you for joining us for your birthday! It sounds like you enjoyed our service, atmosphere, and Classic Double Patty Cheeseburger, and we're happy to hear you had a good time. We hope you will be back soon.

comment.text:
Came here with my mom and sister for dinner. The place is located on the second level of a shopping plaza type area with nice shops and dining. There is a parking garage and valet available so no hassles with street spots. If you take your ticket into the restaurant they will validate it for you (free, if your stay is 2 hours or less). Just ask the hostess how to validate your ticket on your way out.

I had the buttermilk fried chicken which tasted great. The sweet potato cornbread is so moist and delicious

owner_replies.comment: Hi Leslie, thank you for taking the time to provide us with a review of your visit. We are pleased to hear you, your mom, and your sister had a nice dinner, and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

comment.text:
The Southern Gentleman is located in Buckhead Village, next to Gypsy Kitchen. There is some street metered parking (4hr max), but there is also a parking garage (0-3hrs $5). 

The restaurant opened at 4pm and we got there around 4:15 on a Monday. It is usually best to make a reservation, but we didn't this time because they had just opened and had tons of availability. As we walked in, we were seated right away. 

Our server, Shannon, came over right away with waters and to go over the menu. She was great! And straight to it. She told us all of her favorite menu items, and the way she described everything we had to try them. We started with the Deviled Eggs and the White Cheddar Hushpuppies. I usually find Hushpuppies kinda dry, but these were moist and the goat cheese crema with sugarcane syrup topped it off! Oh and fyi they do have happy hour M-F 4-6pm on food and drinks! For drinks we got the Grey Goose Spritzer and the Southern Gentleman. 

All of the entrees "Supper" looked good. We decided on the Braised Short Rib and Pan Seared Redfish. The food came out hot and perfectly prepared. The short rib was juicy and so tender it could be cut with a fork. The red fish came with a Geechie style rice purloo, which was the perfect pair for the fish. With all the delicious food we had to get a dessert. We ordered the Fried Apple Turnover...but when Shannon checked with the kitchen they were out of it. She was very apologetic and brought us the Chocolate layer cake AND the coconut cream pie because of the slight confusion. 

The dining experience at The Southern Gentleman was on of the best experiences I've had in a while thanks to Shannon! She was an amazing server. Very attentive, she took time to get to know us, and we're basically family now lol. I will definitely be back!

owner_replies.comment: Ash, we genuinely appreciate you letting us know that, and we will be sure to let Shannon hear she made your visit so enjoyable. Thank you for your very nice review, and we look forward to serving you again soon.

comment.text: I want to go back. I loved this place. I had a wonderful birthday dinner. I got a strawberry lemon drop and the fried chicken with the sweet potato bread and greens. Absolutely amazing. The greens had a smoky flavor to them. The fried chicken was seasoned well and tender. Also had the deviled eggs for appetizer. My friend got the pot roast with the potatoes and although I didn't try I can tell it was tender. The restaurant was nice and clean. The lighting was low and beautiful setting. Our waiter was attentive and nice as well. I will be returning next time I visit.

owner_replies.comment: Hi DeeDee. We're happy you joined us for such a special occasion! It's wonderful to hear you and your friend enjoyed your dining experience. Thank you for your kind words, and we hope you'll be back again someday soon, either for another celebration or a special evening out!

comment.text:
Had dinner here for my dad's 60th birthday. I have been to the restaurant for brunch previously but not for dinner. Let me start off by saying that our waitress Shannon was absolutely AMAZING!! She was very personable, provided great service, and had great energy which contributed to the overall experience.

Now for the food. We started with the white cheddar hushpuppies as an appetizer which was great. For our main course, my parents and myself had the braised short rib which came with sauteed spinach, mashed potatoes, and onion strings (as decor). Loved the short rib! It was very tender and juicy. We also ordered a side of mac n' cheese which was equally amazing.

For dessert, we ordered the chocolate layered cake and fried apple turnover. I prefer the apple turnover over the chocolate cake. They also gave my dad a birthday pudding and our table complementary champagne with our dessert. This was a fantastic experience and I'm looking forward to brunch/dinner here again soon.

owner_replies.comment: Mya, we're so pleased you chose us for your dad's 60th celebration. It sounds like you enjoyed your dinner, and Shannon did an excellent job for your party. Thank you, and we look forward to seeing you for another brunch or dinner someday soon!

comment.text: Wonderful atmosphere, and delicious food. Loved the Mimosas Flight, and the pancake skillet. Very filling and reasonably priced! Sit inside or outside, either way, it's a win.

owner_replies.comment: Tiffany, we're so pleased you enjoyed our food an mimosas. We look forward to serving you again someday, inside or out! Thank you.

comment.text:
I am really impressed on how this restaurant was ran from the beginning to end. I take my wife out a lot and not service is sort of slow, but here we were welcomed immediately. The food was really good and the service..... We are feeling the southern hospitality in ATL! 

I want to really highlight our waitress Shannon. She had great energy and made us feel like VIP. That girl is about her tips and she is worth every penny. Lastly I would definitely be a repeat customer and recommend clients and friends to visit The Southern Gentleman at Buckhead.

owner_replies.comment: Ernest, thank you for letting us know how much you and your wife enjoyed your visit. That is great to hear, and we'll be sure to pass along your compliments to Shannon. We hope you do become a repeat customer, and we look forward to serving you again soon!

comment.text: The food is delicious. Love the fried chicken and greens.  The drinks were good, desserts good. Ambience excellent. Service spectacular! There was a wedding party and we just had to celebrate them. This is a great spot for good food and awesome atmosphere.

owner_replies.comment: Mark, your kind words mean a lot to us. We're so glad you enjoyed our food, ambiance, and service so much. We love helping people celebrate special occasions as well, and we hope you'll join us again soon. Thank you!

comment.text: I love this spot! It's my favorite fried chicken in Atlanta. Crispy outside, juicy inside. The pork chop is also wonderful! The cocktails are Great! Get an old fashioned or try an espresso martini with Jameson. Michael was a wonderful server- such a fun and friendly attitude. This place is a little hidden (behind Gypsy Kitchen) so go find it and give it a try.

owner_replies.comment: C.G., thank you so much for your kind words. We're thrilled to hear that you loved our fried chicken so much, and it's great to know that our cocktails hit the spot for you as well. We appreciate your shoutout to Michael, and we hope to see you again soon.

comment.text: Came here for a Friendsgiving with my linesisters last night, and had a really beautiful time. Love the dim lights in this venue. They also provide two hour validation if you park in the adjacent garage. I ordered the trout which was really delicious but wasn't very filling. I should have ordered some sides with it. I ended up getting the sweet potato cornbread later and I would say RUN to get a bite of this! It's SO good! Definitely the highlight of the meal. Lastly, Makayla our server was so awesome. Super attentive and accommodating. Would definitely come back just to request her.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Kiah, thank you for sharing your experience at our restaurant. We're glad to hear that you had a beautiful time and enjoyed the ambiance. We are thrilled to hear how much you loved the sweet potato cornbread. We'll also make sure to pass along your kind words to Makayla. Hopefully, you'll be back soon for another wonderful dining experience.

comment.text: A group of about 6 to 8 of us came in on a Saturday afternoon. Cute establishment. Parking garage nearby. We were seated once everyone in our party arrived. I ordered the Southern Fried Chicken & Country Skillet Cake. It was delicious. Chicken was tender and fried crunchy. The skillet Cake reminds me of really sweet jiffy cornbread. Very good and soft with a nice crisp on the outside. I ordered the Fashioned Gentlemen. Good strong drink but the other people in my party seemed to really enjoy the mimosas. They all also enjoyed their food but I can't tell you what they all ordered. Service was friendly and attentive.

owner_replies.comment: Hi there Sheek. Thank you for your visit and for this kind review! We're glad you all enjoyed your food and cocktails and that you found the service attentive and friendly. We hope to see you again sometime soon!

comment.text:
We're here for a brunch day on a Saturday afternoon, saying that it was the best experience is an understatement! 

Our waitress Bella was so sweet, she had great suggestions for what to order on their summer 2023 brunch menu, and we had a great light conversation. Upon entering, we immediately felt welcomed. The manager sat us outside on the patio, it had the best views of The skyline in Buckhead.

The food was great, kudos to the chef! Southern gentleman's Mamosa carafe is probably a Buckhead, well-kept secret, we had enough for about seven mimosas, and at only 44 bucks I think that's a steal :) 

Definitely will be back  :))))

photos.caption: Southern Fried Chicken & Country Skillet Cake, Breakfast Potatoes

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your visit, Gelene, and for this wonderful five-star review! We're thrilled to hear you enjoyed your brunch so much, especially your carafe of mimosas and Bella's service! We'll be sure to share your compliments with her, and look forward to seeing you again very soon!

comment.text:
Beautifully decorated restaurant, very clean and modern. Wasn't too crowded at 5pm on a Friday, which is a good thing...there is a nearby parking lot which you can get validated 2 hours for if you dine in.

Service was fast and friendly, food wonderfully delicious! We started with Fried Green Tomatoes (crispy and refreshing) and for entree Pan Roasted Trout, smooth and tasty!

Recommended, nice for casual or fancy but can get quite loud for conversations!

photos.caption: Three dinner entrees and three liquors!

owner_replies.comment: Nancy, we're happy to hear you enjoyed your meal so much. Thank you for your very kind words, and we look forward to serving you again soon!

comment.text:
FABULOUS! Went for brunch with the girls and had a fantastic time. Rachel was our waitress and she provided one of the best services I've had in a long time! The food and drinks (the bartender) were amazing! The parking situation was a bit confusing, but just find the parking deck and you're all set; street parking was also available, along with valet for preferences. 

Seriously would come here regularly and have either brunch, happy hour and or dinner and request Rachel for service!

photos.caption: Mimosa Flight and Braised Short Rib

owner_replies.comment: Kimberly, thank you for your fabulous review! We're thrilled to hear that you had a fantastic time, and Rachel will be delighted to know you enjoyed her service so much. We look forward to welcoming you back for brunch, happy hour, or dinner soon!

comment.text:
The host was very nice and our server was sweet. Overall the food was good, however everything came out so fast, felt rushed. The deviled eggs were delicious, as were the fried green tomatoes.
We didn't even receive our wine and our entrees were presented. 
The short rib was good, however I had diarrhea all night. 
The trout looked like it came from a tiny stream, it was so small. 
I doubt we would return.

owner_replies.comment:
Sean, thank you for taking the time to provide feedback. We're glad you appreciated our staff and enjoyed the delicious deviled eggs and fried green tomatoes. However, we apologize for any inconvenience caused by the pace of service. We value this feedback and will address this internally so it's not an issue again. Hopefully, you'll reconsider giving us another chance. Please contact me directly the next time you want to join us so I can personally make sure you have an excellent dining experience.
Nathan Shryock, General Manager
nshryock@sphospitality.com

comment.text: It's a classy place. Great Southern classic menu. Food was served quickly, which isn't really a great thing. Had hush puppies and short ribs. Food was lukewarm. Expected more.

owner_replies.comment:
Thank you for your visit, Benji. I'm pleased to hear you were impressed with our menu, but I apologize if we let you down in other ways. I'd love a second chance to impress you on a future visit. Next time you can make it in, please ask for me so I can make sure you have a great dining experience. I hope to see you soon.
Chris Lamoree, General Manager

comment.text: Great food and fast service. I ordered the chicken and waffles. The flavors were wonderful and well worth the price for brunch but wasn't pack and the service was fantastic. Highly recommend ordering a Bloody Mary with the meal for brunch

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for joining us for brunch, Liberty. We're happy to hear you enjoyed our food, drinks, and service so much. Hopefully, you will be back again someday soon!

comment.text: A southern gentleman? More like a southern feast! I got the Braised Short Rib and they were *chefs kiss*  the drinks were also great I think I had like 4 of the apple pie old fashions so you know it was a good night! Next time skip I'll  the deviled eggs, the devil went down to Georgia but they certainly weren't for those eggs

owner_replies.comment: That's great to hear you enjoyed our braised short rib and drinks, Mary Beth. Thank you so much for your very kind words (and funny comment on the eggs). We look forward to serving you again soon!

comment.text: Food was amazing overall. The deviled eggs were  a perfect pick to start the food journey during brunch. The bacon egg and cheese sandwich was cooked just right with a nice flavor. The service was ok- as I server was not very attentive. They could improve there. The overall environment and setting was upscale and the right type of energy

photos.caption: Bacon Bacon, Egg & Cheese Croissant Sandwich

owner_replies.comment: S J, thank you for your great comments regarding our food. However, we apologize for any lack of attentiveness you felt, and we'll make sure that is not an issue again. Thank you for your feedback, and we hope to welcome you back soon for another enjoyable dining experience sometime soon.

comment.text: Service was great and food portions were even better! Loved that the greens were made without pork. We went on a Monday afternoon and it wasn't crowded at all. The patio looked nice but it was about to storm. I did notice that they let down the windows so patio seating wasn't interrupted when the bad weather came through.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Tonisha! We're so glad you joined us and enjoyed your meal and our service so much! Thank you for your wonderful review. Next time maybe the weather will cooperate and you can enjoy dining on the patio. We hope we have you back with us again very soon!

comment.text:
Out in Atlanta visiting and wanting some great food. 
This place did not disappoint. 
Food was delicious. Very fresh and flavorful. 
Loved the vibes. 
Very cute upscale restaurant. 

The food definitely matches the ambiance. 
Definitely a must try in the Buckhead area.

owner_replies.comment: Ronni, thank you for choosing our restaurant during your visit. We're happy that you enjoyed our food and ambiance. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to welcoming you back for more memorable meals in the future.

comment.text:
I've been wanting to visit here for over a year now. I finally found a good time for my friends and I to check it out for brunch. We were easily able to call in and make a reservation of 7 for Sunday. Upon arrival we were seated outside unexpectedly. It was not a big deal because it was a nice day outside but it would have been nice to have been given a heads up when the reservation was confirmed.

We had some time to review the menu and everything looked so good that we had a hard time making up our minds. Some of the things we ordered were the white cheddar hush puppies, deviled eggs, Southern fried chicken & skillet cake, burgers. We also got a variety of drinks including the mimosa flights, Expresso martini, Breakfast in GA, Southern Belle. Everything was amazing and I cannot wait to come back!

owner_replies.comment: Hi Quiana. We're happy you joined us and enjoyed your brunch with us. We apologize if you weren't expecting outdoor seating, and we'll be sure to ask people their seating preferences moving forward. We look forward to seeing you again soon. Thank you!

comment.text:
Updated Review 2.0!!

Food 9/10
Service  9/10
Ambiance 9-10
Service was definitely better this Sunday around. 11/27 as I came with friends. Our waitress Michelle was attentive, Our drinks came out first, then our appetizers & our main course. It was really a chilled vibe, & I'm glad I gave them a second chance. If you haven't been yet. Make your away to the Southern Gentleman

photos.caption: Mimosa Flight  Fried Chicken & Skillet Cake

owner_replies.comment: Hi Simone. Thank you for joining us. We are pleased to know you enjoyed our food and ambiance but we apologize if our service missed the mark in any way. We look forward to having you back with your friends for what we're confident will be an outstanding dining experience. Please let us know.

comment.text:
Amazing food and drinks at this restaurant. We came by and were blown away with the food. We had appetizers and entrees which all were all very good. DJ the chef prepared an outstanding dish and the peach cobbler was just like Grandma made it. Truly amazing! You will definitely enjoy yourself here. Great location with easy parking and accessible for all. When we are back in town we will be back. I would recommend this to all to check out. You will not be disappointed at all!  Nice ambiance for couples and family. 
The bar area is nice and the bartenders are on the money with the drinks and service. Sorry I didn't have any pictures to share we eat everything up!

owner_replies.comment: Steve, that's very kind of you to say. Thank you. We hope you'll be back soon for more items "just like Grandma made!"

comment.text: The Southern Gentleman is in a tucked away location up on a terrace. We sat inside and the place is pretty open with the bar in the middle and televisions on with sports playing. Service was great and our server was a little soft spoken but attentive. I had the pan roasted trout which was absolutely delicious, perfectly pan roasted and fresh (it did not taste like trout). It was sitting on a nice blend of vegetables and roasted finagling potatoes with a puréed garlic that was brilliantly accompanied with a balsamic glaze. I tried the French fries on the double cheeseburger entree and they were great as well and nicely salted. Definitely a place I would like to visit again next time I am in town.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Stephanie. Thank you for your kind words and this stellar review! We're so happy you joined us and enjoyed your food and service so much. We hope you do come back again someday, the next time you're in town. We look forward to serving you again!

comment.text:
Flew my mother in from Austin TX for mother's day... first time here, and extremely disappointed with the food quality. My husband's mom's food came out cold (the lobster) and rubbery, and my mother's food was inedible. Hard bacon that she could tap against a glass. Everything came out within less than five minutes, which I imagine is because it was prepped beforehand. Just an overall awful experience.

Edit: the uniformity here was strange as well. We ordered two chocolate cakes slices for dessert - one was large with no white cream on top, and the other was extremely small with the cream. To the credit of the manager, he did bring my husband another larger slice for free, which was nice.

I was pretty embarrassed to have flown my mom into town for a few hours and this was the experience she had.

owner_replies.comment:
Patricia, we truly appreciate you choosing us for a Mother's Day meal, but that certainly is not the experience we aim to deliver. Please accept my apologies. I'd love to apologize directly and have a second chance to impress you as well. Please reach out to me at
nshryock@sphospitality.com with the best way to contact you, and I look forward to being in touch. 
Thank you, Nathan Shryock, General Manager

comment.text: I came here for my birthday with two friends in February 2022. I got the pork entree. Forgot which appetizers we shared but I know I liked both more than my main. The drinks were well made too! The pork dish was just a bit salty for me and it was getting hard to finish as the flavors got stronger

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for joining us for your birthday, Megan. We wish we had known your main dish wasn't ideal for you, so we could have brought you something else you would have loved. Hopefully, we'll have the chance to serve you again someday for what we're confident will be an outstanding dining experience in every way!

comment.text:
I will return again!

Caught dinner with friends during a business conference and I was so pleased. We started with appetizers of the hush puppies, crab cakes and deviled eggs. The white cheddar hush puppies were the standout app, so yummy I'm drooling writing about them right now. 

We then all ordered the grilled New York strip with seared tomatoes and asparagus, Demi glacé and pomme purée (a fancy mashed potatoes dish). I added a glass of Malbec to compliment my entree and thoroughly indulged. 

The kitchen even cuts the steak perfectly for you so all you have to do is feed yourself. Ooh la la! I have to visit again the next time I'm in the A.

owner_replies.comment: Darla, we are so happy to hear your kind compliments. Thank you so much for your very kind words and we're happy to know you enjoyed your meal. We look forward to serving you again soon!

comment.text: Hush puppies are a must! Devil eggs were also amazing. No one was a big fan of the steak tartare. Pork rinds tasted home made they were enjoyed. Green tomatoes with pomegranate to cheese were good. After apps the gas line went out down the road and we could only have cold food. The staff was super accommodating during the time but we had to leave and never got to eat. Super bummed because I was looking forward to the meal after the good apps. Thanks to our server and Chris for taking care of us

owner_replies.comment: Kelly, we are so glad you enjoyed what you were able to sample, but please accept our apologies for that very unusual occurrence regarding the gas line. We look forward to having you back someday soon so you can experience our entire menu. Thank you!

comment.text:
Service was excellent old-fashioned was great. Food was not the best, burger was burned, but of milk fried chicken is under seasons, the best thing on that plate was the sweet potato cornbread and avocados lol
Dessert we had banana pie the bananas were not ripe and the crust was hard as Hades.

photos.caption: Banana banana pie with unriped bananas and hard crust
Mac and cheese with no flavors bring your own seasons lol
Delicious avocados best thing on the menu
Burns Burger okay fries presentation was nice
Buttermilk fried chicken sweet potato cornbread collard greens blah
Southern German old fashioned pretty nice

owner_replies.comment: Michelle, it sounds like you enjoyed our Old Fashioned, and we appreciate the compliment. However, we are sorry to hear you didn't feel your food was perfect. Please know if ever something you order isn't exactly as you had hoped, we want to hear about it on the spot so we can make you a new version or help you choose something else you will love. Thank you, and hopefully you will be back soon for what what we're confident will be an excellent dining experience in every way.

comment.text: Have been here twice now and the food never disappoints. Came once with my team and a second time with my family. Great little spot in Buckhead, in a nice mall and has a very nice bourbon selection.

photos.caption: Southern Fried Chicken & Country Skillet Cake

owner_replies.comment: Matthew, thank you so much for coming in. It's wonderful to hear that you and your team had a great experience with us and that you enjoyed our Fried Chicken. We hope to serve you again sometime in the near future!

comment.text: Food here is amazing! Everything was great quality, good portions, and tasty! Great feels- very lively and bright. We came for brunch and got to sit on the patio to catch some sun. Service was a bit slow but since we weren't in a rush, we didn't mind it.

photos.caption: Southern Fried Chicken & Country Skillet Cake and Gulf Shrimp & Grits*

owner_replies.comment: Hi Mai. Thank you for your very kind comments. We're happy to know you enjoyed your brunch in the sun, and we'll be sure to keep an eye on the service speed so that is not an issue. We hope to serve you again someday in the near future!

comment.text:
Went for a birthday dinner. It was everything. Mac and cheese was delish! I know folks of all races can cook. But I believe someone of color is in the kitchen whose sole job is to make Mac and cheese. It was that good. 

Fried chicken was yummy. Oh, and had something with homemade pimento cheese. Ya'll, it's the real deal. They should call it Nike.... Cause they done did it with that cheese. 

Now, the greens. I dunno. I could eat them, but I'd prefer never to have to again. 
The decor is nice. It is lovely outside. Great place for selfies at night. Very pretty view.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Naa'ila, thank you for your kind words and for celebrating a birthday with us! We love knowing you enjoyed our homemade pimento cheese and our decor so much. We hope to see you again soon for another great dining experience!
